Design Pattern - Adapter (Wrapper)

Created:2018-03-19  Last modified:2018-03-19

  • Introduction
  • Examples
  • Pluggable adapter

  1. Introduction

    A well-defined class provides a couple of general methods. Your project defines your own interface. The adapter class wrappes the well-defines method to implement your interface

    • Target: your project's interface: decouple client and implementation
    • Client: call the target
    • Adapter: implements the target interface
    • Adaptee: the core of the adapter

    Implementation of the adapter: composition vs. inheritance

  2. Examples

    1. Your class defines an interface:

                      public interface Num{
                    int getNum();
                }

    2. You want to implement a random number. Instead of implementing from scratch, you want to use the Java Random .nextInt(). However, the random class does not implement your interface.

      You have to convert the java random to your implementation

    3. Adapter class by composition

                      public class RandomNum implements Num{
                    private Random rand = new Random();
                    @Override
                    public int getNum(){
                        return rand.nextInt(1000); // The adapter may introduce a few decision. 
                    }
                }

      Adapter class by inheritance

                      public class RandomNum extends Random implements Num{
                    
                    @Override
                    public int getNum(){
                        return nextInt(1000); // The adapter may introduce a few decision. 
                    }
                }

      The adapter class may need to do some decision. Because the interface is pre-defined, user cannot pass this decision from outside as arguments. One way to solve it is to use "config file"

  3. Pluggable adapter

    Sometimes, the adaptee is not general. For example, not every adaptee has nextInt as Random. The pluggable adapter is to use class name + method name to find the target method at runtime by Java reflection.

    e.g. new Adapter("java.util.Random","nextInt")

  4. References

    1. 可插入的适配器(Pluggable adapter)
